subject: Mental Health
title: Sleep and the Teen Brain
description: A 60-second lesson on Sleep and the Teen Brain.

hook.text: Your teen isn't lazy â€” their brain's clock literally shifted two hours later at puberty.

buildup.text: Melatonin release shifts later in adolescence, making early bedtimes biologically difficult.

discovery.text: Teens need 8 to 10 hours of sleep but most get fewer than 7 on school nights.

twist.text: Sleep deprivation mimics ADHD symptoms and worsens depression and anxiety in teens.

climax.text: Schools that delayed start times saw improved grades, attendance, and mental health.

punchline.text: The first mental health intervention for teens might be a later alarm.

quiz.question: Why do teens struggle to fall asleep early?
options: Melatonin release shifts later during puberty
